title: Countries with the fastest growing economies from 2001 to 2010
yAxis: Annual average GDP growth in percent
summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Annual average GDP growth in percent in each Country on the y axis.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is appeared to be the highest at Country Angola and lowest at Country Rwanda.
There is a difference of 3.5 between the maximum Country Angola and minimum Country Rwanda.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Annual average GDP growth in percent in the y axis.
The maximum Annual average GDP growth in percent 11.1 is found at Country Angola and the minimum is found at Rwanda where Country is 7.6.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Annual average GDP growth in percent in each Country on the y axis.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is appeared to be the highest at Country Angola and lowest at Country Rwanda.
There is a difference of 3.5 between the maximum Country Angola and minimum Country Rwanda.
max_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Annual average GDP growth in percent in each Country on the y axis.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is highest at Country Angola and lowest at Country Rwanda.
Country China has the second highest value for Annual average GDP growth in percent.
The maximum Country Angola has got 1.46 times higher Annual average GDP growth in percent than the minimum Country Rwanda.
Annual average GDP growth in percent at Country Angola is 11.1 , second place is China at 10.5, and thirdly is Myanmar at 10.3.
Country Chad, and Mozambique have the same Annual average GDP growth in percent.
The highest value 11.1 at Angola is almost 1.25 times larger than the average value 8.85.
The Annual average GDP growth in percent is 88.5 if we add up values of all Countrys.
